title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
ExplainableAI.jl to Julia-XAI

JuliaCon 2022: ExplainableAI.jl
JuliaCon 2024: Julia-XAI organization







What is Julia-XAI?


Ecosystem of packages providing a platform for the development of new XAI methods:
github.com/Julia-XAI









What kind of explanations?


Post-hoc, local input-space explanations of black-box models:

‚ÄúWhich part of the input is responsible for the model‚Äôs output?‚Äù

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
Methods

ExplainableAI.jl ‚Äì applicable on any differentiable classifier

Gradient
InputTimesGradient
SmoothGrad Smilkov et al. (2017)
IntegratedGradients Sundararajan, Taly, and Yan (2017)
üÜï GradCAM Selvaraju et al. (2017)

RelevancePropagation.jl ‚Äì applicable on Flux.jl classifiers

LRP Bach et al. (2015)

üÜï support for ResNets
üÜï support for Transformers Ali et al. (2022), Achtibat et al. (2024)

üÜï CRP Achtibat et al. (2023)

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
Example: vision models


using Flux, Metalhead
model = VGG(19; pretrain=true).layers
testmode!(model)

prediction = model(input)
class = argmax(prediction) # class 484: castle

 Downloading artifact: vgg19-IMAGENET1K_V1


CartesianIndex(484, 1)


Pretrained model predicts class ‚Äúcastle‚Äù. But why?

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
Methods: input sensitivity

using ExplainableAI
using VisionHeatmaps

analyzer = Gradient(model)
expl = analyze(input, analyzer)
heatmap(expl)

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
Methods: GradCAM

using ExplainableAI
using VisionHeatmaps

analyzer = GradCAM(model[1], model[2])
expl = analyze(input, analyzer)
heatmap_overlay(expl, img)

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
Methods: LRP

using RelevancePropagation
using VisionHeatmaps

analyzer = LRP(model, EpsilonPlusFlat())
explanation = analyze(input, analyzer)
heatmap(explanation)

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
TextHeatmaps.jl
Visualize explanations on language models

using TextHeatmaps

words = split("I loved the concert but not the opening act")
val = [0.1, 2.5, 0.0, 0.3, -0.6, -1.4, 0.0, 0.1, -0.1]
TextHeatmaps.heatmap(val, words)

WARNING: using TextHeatmaps.heatmap in module Notebook conflicts with an existing identifier.


Ilovedtheconcertbutnottheopeningact



TextHeatmaps.heatmap(val, words; rangescale=:extrema)

Ilovedtheconcertbutnottheopeningact



using ColorSchemes
TextHeatmaps.heatmap(val, words; colorscheme=:inferno)

Ilovedtheconcertbutnottheopeningact

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
XAIBase.jl
Interface definition:

method has to be a subtype of AbstractXAIMethod
method has to return Explanation







Benefits



automatically compute heatmaps using VisionHeatmaps.jl and TextHeatmaps.jl
dependency free
perfect for package extensions!

title: What‚Äôs new with Explainable AI in Julia?
text:
References


Achtibat, Reduan, Maximilian Dreyer, Ilona Eisenbraun, Sebastian Bosse, Thomas Wiegand, Wojciech Samek, and Sebastian Lapuschkin. 2023. ‚ÄúFrom Attribution Maps to Human-Understandable Explanations Through Concept Relevance Propagation.‚Äù Nature Machine Intelligence 5 (9): 1006‚Äì19. https://doi.org/10.1038/s42256-023-00711-8.


Achtibat, Reduan, Sayed Mohammad Vakilzadeh Hatefi, Maximilian Dreyer, Aakriti Jain, Thomas Wiegand, Sebastian Lapuschkin, and Wojciech Samek. 2024. ‚ÄúAttnlrp: Attention-Aware Layer-Wise Relevance Propagation for Transformers.‚Äù arXiv Preprint arXiv:2402.05602.


Ali, Ameen, Thomas Schnake, Oliver Eberle, Gr√©goire Montavon, Klaus-Robert M√ºller, and Lior Wolf. 2022. ‚ÄúXAI for Transformers: Better Explanations Through Conservative Propagation.‚Äù In International Conference on Machine Learning, 435‚Äì51. PMLR.


Bach, Sebastian, Alexander Binder, Gr√©goire Montavon, Frederick Klauschen, Klaus-Robert M√ºller, and Wojciech Samek. 2015. ‚ÄúOn Pixel-Wise Explanations for Non-Linear Classifier Decisions by Layer-Wise Relevance Propagation.‚Äù PloS One 10 (7): e0130140.


Selvaraju, Ramprasaath R, Michael Cogswell, Abhishek Das, Ramakrishna Vedantam, Devi Parikh, and Dhruv Batra. 2017. ‚ÄúGrad-Cam: Visual Explanations from Deep Networks via Gradient-Based Localization.‚Äù In Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision, 618‚Äì26.


Smilkov, Daniel, Nikhil Thorat, Been Kim, Fernanda Vi√©gas, and Martin Wattenberg. 2017. ‚ÄúSmoothgrad: Removing Noise by Adding Noise.‚Äù arXiv Preprint arXiv:1706.03825.


Sundararajan, Mukund, Ankur Taly, and Qiqi Yan. 2017. ‚ÄúAxiomatic Attribution for Deep Networks.‚Äù In International Conference on Machine Learning, 3319‚Äì28. PMLR.
